description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dptcn","text":"This sequencing protocol is intended to directly follow and use the PCR products of a primary PCR amplification protocol (e.g., 12S rRNA, 18S rRNA V9, cytochrome c oxidase subunit I (COI) mitochondrial gene). Primary PCR products were produced at MBARI and sent to Michigan State University's (MSU) Research Technology Support Facility (RTSF) Genomics Core for indexing, pooling, and sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6osfq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80gee","text":"Secondary PCR primers used: PE1-BC-CS1, PE2-BC-CS2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aep9n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnqq1","text":"This indexing PCR protocol is used to uniquely index the amplified DNA products of each sample. This is necessary so the sequencing results can be demultiplexed and the reads can be properly identified and assigned to each individual sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b56a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Environmental DNA (eDNA) 12S Metabarcoding PCR Protocol (with Platinum SuperFi II Taq)

funders.funder_name: National Marine Sanctuaries as Sentinel Sites for a Demonstration Marine Biodiversity Observation Network (MBON)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"6har5","text":"Summary\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5j98j","text":"The PCR protocol is used to uniquely index PCR amplicon products from the primary taxa-targeting PCR step using gene-targeting PCR primers (e.g., 12S rRNA, 18S rRNA V9, cytochrome c oxidase subunit I (COI) mitochondrial gene). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6h8r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4kii","text":"This work was supported by NASA grant NNX14AP62A ‘National Marine Sanctuaries as Sentinel Sites for a Demonstration Marine Biodiversity Observation Network (MBON)’ funded under the National Ocean Partnership Program (NOPP RFP NOAA-NOS-IOOS-2014-2003803 in partnership between NOAA, BOEM, and NASA), and the U.S. Integrated Ocean Observing System (IOOS) Program Office.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ub6l","text":"Method description and rationale\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pqir","text":"This protocol is performed at Michigan State University's (MSU) Research Technology Support Facility(RTSF) Genomics Core (https://rtsf.natsci.msu.edu/genomics/) to prepare amplicon projects for MiSeq sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":122,"length":37}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2E72FA646A0911EFA4880A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://rtsf.natsci.msu.edu/genomics"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87o37","text":"Spatial coverage and environment(s) of relevance\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f8pi","text":"This protocol has been used to uniquely index amplified extracted DNA from filtered sea water samples taken from marine coastal stations off the western coast of North America (primarily off of California).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbi5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0idg","text":"sea water [ENVO:00002149]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64mda","text":"http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00002149","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":44}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CD4930BC832F11EEAC7A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00002149"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"denhv","text":"Personnel Required\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75gad","text":"1 technician.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24l4l","text":"Safety\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d9un","text":"Identify hazards associated with the procedure and specify protective equipment and safety training required to safely execute the procedure","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gce7","text":"Training requirements\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f96u6","text":"Sterile technique, pipetting skills.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brb83","text":"Time needed to execute the procedure\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7cjj","text":"Total time is 6 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5he3m","text":"PCR preparation and running the PCR protocol takes 1 hours. Running the following gel is 1 hour, bead cleanup setup preparation and process takes 2 hours, and then sample normalization and pooling takes 2 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2u98k","text":"In the following SOP, please use the exact names of equipment as noted in the table above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61aqi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2012h","text":"Provide a step-by-step description of the protocol. The identification of difficult steps in the protocol and the provision of recommendations for the execution of those steps are encouraged.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1i8bc","text":"BEFORE STARTING","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71fds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p8kp","text":"Disinfect work surfaces with 10% bleach or RNase Away followed by a MilliQ / DI water rinse and 70% ethanol wipe. Clean pipet surfaces with RNase Away and ethanol wipe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ema6","text":"UV pipets, molecular grade water, and tube racks for 30 minutes prior to starting protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qfha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f05l4","text":"eDNA template \u0026 PCR processing were performed at the Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute (MBARI). PCR reactions were performed with a two-step amplification protocol for each sample using the gene-targeting primers (e.g., 12S MiFish, 18S V9, COI, or 16S V4-V5) with Fluidigm adapters CS1 \u0026 CS2. The resulting amplicon product from the primary PCR was bead cleaned, quantified, then sent to MSU for indexing. Below are the steps for the secondary amplificaiton. Library normaliztion, pooling, and sequencing are described in a complementary protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bh4a","text":"An agarose gel was run after secondary PCR to confirm the presence of target bands and absence of non-specific amplification across environmental samples as well as the absence of amplification in NTCs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0e2k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kimc","text":"Products from the protocol are then used to create a pooled library and sequenced following a separate sequencing protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6j67o","text":"Kozich, J. J. et al. Development of a dual-index sequencing strategy and curation pipeline for analyzing amplicon sequence data on the MiSeq Illumina sequencing platform. Applied and environmental microbiology 79, 5112–5120 (2013).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aee4a","text":"https://www.neb.com/en-us/protocols/2012/09/10/onetaq-hot-start-2x-master-mix-with-standard-buffer-m0484","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":104}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A29A85196A0C11EFB48C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.neb.com/en-us/protocols/2012/09/10/onetaq-hot-start-2x-master-mix-with-standard-buffer-m0484"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj874","text":"Link templates (e.g. preformatted spreadsheets) used to record measurements and report on the quality of the data as well as any documents such as manufacturer specifications, images, etc that support this protocol. Please include a short note describing the document’s relevance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57sp8","text":"The following steps are performed by MSU’s RTSF Genomics Core","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61},{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"fg6pt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edlp8","text":"1. Secondary amplification and NGS were performed at Michigan State University’s Research Technology Support Facility (RTSF). An aliquot of 20 μL from each purified primary PCR product was sent to RTSF Genomics Core at MSU for secondary PCR amplification with primers which targeted the CS1/CS2 ends of the primary PCR products and added dual indexed, Illumina compatible adapters with barcodes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0al4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9od28","text":"PE1-BC-CS1 (forward): ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8flv","text":"AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCT-[i5-BC(index 2)]-ACACTGACGACATGGTTCTACA","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":65}],"data":{}},{"key":"9rj1k","text":"PE2-BC-CS2 (reverse): ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcg23","text":"CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGAT-[i7-BC(index 1)]-TACGGTAGCAGAGACTTGGTCT","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":64}],"data":{}},{"key":"af4ne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lsv7","text":"
